intro: Ophiocolea pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered ophiocolea, is a rare and delicate plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Ophiocolea pauciflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
